intro: Valerianella umbilicata, commonly known as the heartleaf valerian, is a small, flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, pale pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features. Valerianella umbilicata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in cool, humid conditions.
